nodes that have left the topology.

nodes.bodyText:
Get_s_ join timeout, in milliseconds. Time to wait for joining. If node cannot connect to any address from the IP
finder, the node continues to try to join during this timeout. If all addresses still do not respond, an
exception will occur and the node will fail to start. If 0 is specified, it means wait forever.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -246,11 +246,16 @@
     public long getSocketTimeout();
 
     /**
-     * Gets join timeout.
+     * Get join timeout, in milliseconds. Time to wait for joining. If node cannot connect to any address from the IP
+     * finder, the node continues to try to join during this timeout. If all addresses still do not respond, an
+     * exception will occur and the node will fail to start. If 0 is specified, it means wait forever.

nodes.bodyText: The join timeout, in milliseconds. Time to wait for joining.  If node cannot connect to any address from the IP finder, the node continues to try to join during this timeout. If all addresses still do not respond, an exception will occur and the node will fail to start. If 0 is specified, it means wait forever.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -246,11 +246,16 @@
     public long getSocketTimeout();
 
     /**
-     * Gets join timeout.
+     * Get join timeout, in milliseconds. Time to wait for joining. If node cannot connect to any address from the IP
+     * finder, the node continues to try to join during this timeout. If all addresses still do not respond, an
+     * exception will occur and the node will fail to start. If 0 is specified, it means wait forever.
      *
      * @return Join timeout.
      */
-    @MXBeanDescription("Join timeout.")
+    @MXBeanDescription("Get join timeout, in milliseconds. Time to wait for joining. " +
+        "If node cannot connect to any address from the IP finder, the node continues to try to join during this timeout. " +
+        "If all addresses still do not respond, an exception will occur and the node will fail to start. " +
+        "If 0 is specified, it means wait forever.")

commit.message: GG-31147 TcpDiscoverySpi incomprehensible metric description. Corrections after the review

nodes.bodyText:
Let's rewrite it in an easier way, "The frequency with which coordinator cleans IP finder and keeps it in the correct state, which means that coordinator unregisters addresses of the nodes that have left the topology and re-registries missing addresses."  Also, it might be helpful to write a link to org.apache.ignite.spi.discovery.tcp.ServerImpl.IpFinderCleaner#cleanIpFinder in javadoc.
Also it would be good to fix javadoc for org.apache.ignite.spi.discovery.tcp.ServerImpl.IpFinderCleaner
